review_text: My business partner and I stayed at Kelli's to get some work done--unfortunately, we were too busy to enjoy any of Houston's many attractions or restaurants, but we did appreciate the nice view of the skyline from the front porch where there are comfortable chairs to relax. The place was perfect for our needs--clean and comfortable, with a large TV screen and table that we needed for our work. The place is nicely furnished with simple decor. The beds were comfortable, great shower, and the kitchen was well-equipped. Nice coffee maker and lots of pods. It was everything we needed for our work meeting and we would love to return next time we meet.

name: Halle
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Exceptional Host! Kelli Goes Above and Beyond.
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Kelli's Airbnb, and I can't say enough positive things about my experience. From the moment I booked until the day I checked out, Kelli was an absolute gem of a host.
First and foremost, Kelli's hospitality was unparalleled. She went out of her way to ensure that my stay was comfortable and enjoyable. From providing detailed instructions for check-in to offering excellent local recommendations, Kelli truly went above and beyond to make me feel welcome.
One aspect that truly stood out was Kelli's flexibility with the check-out time, Kelli was incredibly understanding and accommodating, allowing me to check out later than usual without any hassle. This flexibility made my departure stress-free and allowed me to fully enjoy my last day in the area. If you're looking for a fantastic host who truly cares about their guests' experience look no further than Kelli.

review_text:
Kelli is a great host! Very responsive and attentive to any needs with quick replies. We were low on towels for the amount of guests we were bringing and she brought them over quickly within the half hour of contacting her and it was even midnight!
Great location, walkable brewery a block away and close to downtown and a lot of food and restaurants in the area. The house was a little quirky, You can definitely tell it was updated a little bit compared to the neighbors and the building must have been here a long time. The house was not as great insulated, we came here for Thanksgiving and the weather was great. Not too hot not too cold, definitely got chilly at night so we had to run the heater. In one of the rooms where the heaters are placed a little awkwardly, the heat blows down on you directly in the bed and right in your face. We had to adjust a little bit with the heat and how the house held the heat. Only super bummer at this location is only one bathroom to share and use.

review_text: It turned out that this "awesome bungalow" was better than awesome. Being familiar with the Houston area I can testify that this place is a "slice of heaven". The location could not be better as far as convenience but even the neighborhood was super quiet and chill. A highlight of our stay was the epic view of the city skyline while relaxing on the front porch. Kelli was the perfect host. This was our first Airbnb experience. We will never stay in a hotel again.

review_text: Our stay was perfect. Kelli has a beautiful home and in a perfect location. She is a very responsive host though we didn't have any issues she did check in via AirBNB a few times to make sure we had everything we needed. There are walkable places to eat and get a coffee. She has all the things u need in her home , washer dryer. Coffee machine. TVs are in both bedrooms and living room. The back yard is a nice place to sit at night . The air conditioning was excellent on the very hot days we were there. There is a beautiful view of the city from her front porch and train track about a block away that you can watch when it goes by from the porch. I will def try to stay here again when we come back!

review_text: Usually I have a great experience at my airbnbs and I’ve gone to a couple. But I can’t lie I just didn’t enjoy this airbnb at all. For starters if I wouldve seen the front of the literal shack not tiny home but shack we were staying in, I honestly wouldn’t have booked the stay with them. No pictures of the outside of the “tiny home” were in the listing at all. The pictures they have listed make the place look pretty decently sized but upon arrival it’s honestly not how I imagined. They used wide angle pictures and those are very deceiving , and definitely not accurate. Would say the shed was clean but we found some roaches, underneath the stairs and in the shower was a dead roach. As well as one of the pillows had blood stains on it and idk where that came from so we were not wanting to use the pillows they had provided us. Shower lasted about 5-6 minutes before it got super cold. So take a pretty quick shower. The bed was so uncomfortable we had to stay with family members elsewhere.

My only suggestion would be to possibly add more lighting to the outside of the tiny home. I found myself having to use my phone flash light to put in the code to the door.
Also, be very careful leaving out of the driveway it is very narrow & dark at night.
Overall I had a great experience and I will be back! I would totally recommend.
Thank you!

The availability of shows and movies (Netflix and Prime) on the TV was nice. The street was quiet and safe, I enjoy driving through the neighborhood, with lots of trees and big houses around. Leo was super friendly and accomodating. There is a big dog that will greet you when you park in the driveway, don't let his size intimidate you, it is super sweet and friendly.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a cute older unit with ample space for 2 people. We stayed 3 nights. We didn’t use the kitchen, but it seemed well-equipped. The bed was firm and comfortable. The bathroom had everything we needed but could do with more towel bars/hooks. The unit was missing a hair dryer, but the host team dropped one off. You can park your car right in front of the unit, and there is a security gate in front of the entry door. The neighborhood was nice and felt safe. There were restaurants within walking distance. There was a little noise from upstairs and the street, but overall, it was quiet. The unit was fairly clean with only a few areas that could have been cleaned better. This is an older unit, and it is in need of repairs/renovation. The host team is proactive and seems to be receptive to guest suggestions and eager to address identified concerns.

review_text:
By far, the best kept secret in The Heights! I loved this place, especially the shower/bathroom! I felt the shower was better than any of the best hotels in Houston and I felt so pampered! The oversized tvs and kitchen were just wonderful! Equally inviting were the two private patios - just so well organized and decorated!
I got to witness the 2024 eclipse in totality and the experience was spectacular, but Nathan’s La Casita was right up there in feeling spectacular! I can’t wait to visit again.
Lastly, I felt the ambience and quality of the place relative to the price paid was not proportionate, so I felt compelled to leave Nathan an extra tip! This place deserves 20 stars out of 10, in my opinion

name: Hannah

Rating, 5 stars
,
·

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My La Casita experience was phenomenal and SUCH A VIBE!
Nathan was incredibly friendly and helpful, checking in throughout my stay. Secure parking, a seamless check-in process, and cozy, photogenic rooms made me want to live here! (lol) The comfy bed, plush linens, and spacious walk-in closet exceeded expectations. The well-equipped kitchen facilitated easy breakfast cooking, and I had everything I needed.
The divine bathroom had an amazing waterfall shower and an incredible deep soak bathtub with a private view of plants, and I even saw little squirrels playing and a neighborhood cat tiptoeing across the fence during my morning bubble bath.
On my last morning, I enjoyed soaking up the sun while lounging in the hammock on the porch, reading a book. Nathan is one of the best Airbnb hosts I've had and the space perfectly matched the photos. Without hesitation, I’d stay here again; the thoughtful design and comfort were evident throughout.
Thanks again for an amazing stay!

,

Stayed with kids
review_text:
My family stayed in Vivian's beautiful home in order to be closer to the wedding venue where my son and daughter-in-law got married. The home is spacious and beautifully decorated. There were so many amenities and special touches like a basket of snacks, water bottles, stocked coffee bar, laundry room with plenty of laundry soap and dryer sheets, a ping pong table in the garage, multiple bicycles, exercise equipment with weights, a pack and play, high chair, portable fans, fully stocked bathrooms with lots of toiletries. The primary suite is very roomy with a beautiful ensuite bathroom and walk-in closet. The outdoor patio has multiple seating areas and a wall with greenery that can serve as a backdrop to take photos. There are walking trails right behind the house and a park nearby too.
As a host, Vivian was very professional and with her communications, instructions, and always prompt with her responses.
Highly recommend!

review_text: Alex's place is convenience and safe. The instruction to check-in wasn't clear. It said to check in between 4pm to 10pm to aviod extra charge at the front desk. I got there before 10pm but the front desk was closed. Find out that the front desk was closed at 7pm. I contact Alex and she responsed right away and send self check in instruction which is easy. You just need to go through the parking gate (code provided) and get a key from the lockbox. So far i really like the place. I stay there for two weeks for business. There is gym and laundry there. The room has kitchen, fridge and Microwave. The place is closed to all kinds of restaurants. I recommend to stay.

Stayed over a week
review_text:
If you need to stay in the area for >1 week, this is the place for you! The apartment was well equipped with kitchen utensils, everything was clean, the air conditioner was quiet and worked wonders, the shared laundry room is easy to use and I never needed to wait for a machine. No noise from the neighbours whatsoever!
Alex was very quick to answer my questions. The front desk ladies were also super helpful and friendly.
If I ever come back to Houston, I'm definitely staying again.

name: Long
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: From both arrival and departure: the location of the listing was both peaceful and private. I never had issues with the tenants or the level of noise outside. For those significantly older, the close proximity of the vehicles exiting to the main highway may find this troublesome (I sleep like a log). To accommodate for the high temperatures, the room is cooled to close to a freezing temperature. I am used to hot weather but I did not pay too much attention to the room temperature. I did decide to do one load of laundry before my flight only to realize the front desk provides laundry detergent but not the dryer sheets. Overall, I had a pleasant stay and I would not mind traveling back to stay at this listing as the peace of mind of my rental vehicle behind a gated enclosure was great.

Pros-I loved how easy it was to check in here. And the room was spotless. Bed was clean and free of bugs. Dishes were all clean. Laundry machines were complimentary.
The entire hotel was kept super clean. Air conditioning worked. Bed was super comfy too
Cons the shower water pressure was SUPER low which didn’t make for a good shower, and one night I didn’t have my swipe key with me there was no after hours support I drove back to my work and got my key. Other than those two things it was really nice.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We were very happy to stay at Lamar's Bungalow. The location was perfect for us as we were in town for a concert at the Heights Theater. Restaurants, gift shops, bars, and coffee shops were all an easy 10-20 min walk away and the neighborhood itself was beautiful. The apartment was clean and well-furnished for the two of us. The only note I want to make is that there is a downstairs apartment below this one that was occupied while we were there. The tenant seemed nice and wasn't disruptive, but we could sometimes hear talking or coughing from below and I was worried at times we might be too loud just walking around. That said, it didn't pose much of an issue for us and we would gladly book again.

We didn't want to approach it because raccoons potentially spread rabies, so we called the owner. Within less than 10 minutes, a representative showed up and humanely encouraged the raccoon to move along. Very responsive and effective response to an unusual situation, which we very much appreciated.

Were very happy that time so we were comfortable booking one of her properties again. This place so beats any hotel you could stay in. Clean as a whistle top to bottom. It feels like home. It is basically a quaint small house with all you can want. A cozy living room for a morning coffee. A well appointed lovely small kitchen and attached dining area. The bed was comply and sheets as fresh as can be. We love that the place was nested at the back of a driveway making it feel private and quiet. The Heights is a charming residential neighborhood. We hope this awesome living space is free for us to reserve the next time we come back. It would be our first pick.

name: Christopher
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I typically take a moment to review all of the stays taken; this visit is no different. Not having been to Houston in the past, I spent significant time searching for a place to stay. I was travelling with my girlfriend and was happy with the choice to stay at Lamar's place. My daughter recently moved to Houston and my first visit with her was pleasant. The "Heights" offers a number of restaurants and bars and the neighborhood is ideal for a morning or evening walk. There are a number of options within walking distance to grab a morning coffee. Regarding the unit itself, I found it as advertised. Being from New England, we began to refer to it as the "cabin" given its resemblance to a Maine lakefront cabin we would often frequent. The unit itself is ideal for a couple or single and for shorter stays. We spent little time in the unit, having spent most of our time outside or with my daughter at her home. We never used the stove but it is dated. My girlfriend has some physical limitations which created somewhat of a challenge in the small bathroom and accessing the tub/shower. She also needed time to climb the stairs to enter the unit. The TV was difficult as well, not having your typical cable hookup like we are accustomed to. Thankfully the weather was ideal so TV was not a priority but evenings were focused on Netflix rather than ESPN (no college football or golf). Parking was not an issue. There were others staying in the home and it was very quiet. Overall, I would stay here again.

name: Jessica
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Lamar’s place was awesome! History on the restoration of this apartment was very interesting and informative. The information made us appreciate this quaint apartment even more than expected. Restoration is beautiful and the amenities, such as the thick towels and comfortable bed made our stay perfect. I loved having off-street parking. Close proximity to great restaurants and the neighborhood was beautiful! Lamar was very responsive and even provided some great suggestions for restaurants. I’d definitely stay here again!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Happy that the unit matched the pictures. Was situated relatively close to highway and restaurants. Directions to unit and entry were easy to follow. Parallel parking against fence was tight and maneuvering to get out was challenging given where other cars parked and we had an SUV. The main issue we had was that there was visible black mold in the bathroom. This is a health hazard and clearly been present for some time. We vacated the unit. Thomas offered to move us to another of his properties but that unit was more expensive. We were already being inconvenienced and he wanted to charge us more money to move to another of his units that was currently unrented. This unit should not have been available to rent in that condition. We are certain that Thomas wouldn't live with black mold in his own residence. He argued that it wasn't mold but I sent pictures to him and Airbnb; the latter agreed with our assessment. It was unfortunate since it was otherwise a nice unit.

Additionally, the toilet presented some flushing issues, but Thomas was incredibly responsive and made earnest attempts to address the matter promptly. Despite the persistence of the issue, Thomas' attentiveness and willingness to help were commendable. Overall, the stay was enjoyable, with only minor parking and toilet hiccups that didn't overshadow the positive experience.

name: Treadway
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: The Bonaparte Suite was beautiful and looked just like the pictures. My husband and I were there for his cancer treatments so we stayed for 7 nights. There was great water pressure in the shower and the bed was quite comfortable. The only drawbacks for us were the lack of spare anything. We needed more than one dish towel, more than one hand towel and more than two facecloths. I feel sure if we had seen them, our hosts would’ve been happy to give them to us, but we never saw them. That in itself could be a very good thing as they gave us plenty of privacy. However, I didnt feel comfortable going to their door. No washer had been mentioned in the amenities but I didn’t see it mentioned that there was no dishwasher. I don’t mind washing dishes by hand but i need somewhere to dry them or a drain board. Overalll, it was a nice place and a good value

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We were in Houston for a wedding in the neighborhood. The neighborhood is very cute and walkable and the apartment is clean and fairly spacious for a 2br. We did find it to be lacking a lot of basic amenities like toiletries in the shower and items in the kitchen. My biggest issue with the apartment is the location and access. If you plan on having a lot of things delivered or calling a lot of Ubers, expect to have to walk to meet them or to have to pick things up off a neighbor’s porch. The entry to the house is in a back alley that no one can ever find, which was an issue given all the storms. We really struggled to get people to find our “front door”.

August 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We absolutely loved our stay at Laura’s place! This apartment looks just like the pictures! It is spacious and light, but shades protect against the sometimes too much Houston summer sun. It is spotlessly clean and beautifully furnished, but also comfortable and relaxing. Everything worked perfectly, especially the AC, which, sorry, is important during these 100 degree days. Having 2 bathrooms was a real luxury as was the really cool walk-in shower. It is located in a quieter, walkable part of Houston’s vibrant Heights neighborhood with a mixture of lovely historic homes and gorgeous new ones, close to great restaurants, parks and all amenities. We weren’t tourists, but if you are, there is no better location for easy access to the museum district, fabulous zoo, shopping, medical center, and downtown. In my mind, this is the “Goldilocks” place, where everything is just right! Can’t wait to stay at Laura’s again!

My daughter did a two week Summer intensive at Houston Ballet and this Airbnb was the perfect location for us! It was super close to downtown but also in a really hip area. We LOVED the location! There was an awesome walkable park called Donovan Park that we took our kids to a lot! There was a ton of local restaurants, coffee and shopping in the neighborhood as well.
If you’re looking for a hip and safe neighborhood to stay in when you’re in Houston, then I recommend this super cute Airbnb!

review_text: We were in town for a gymnastics camp, and could not have picked a better place to stay. We loved this Air bnb! It was so clean, well decorated with great bathrooms, and spacious enough for our two girls to hang out and place their things. It sits in a quaint side of town with everything you need close by, including quick access to downtown and the local aquarium. There are great walking/running paths and a play area close by. We were able to find a community pool for the kids as well. There are so many yummy ice cream shops nearby to choose from. While our teammates stayed at the Omni and pretty much stayed in, we enjoyed the local area and came back to the comfort of our home away from home. We will definitely be back next year or anytime we visit. I highly recommend this adorable home!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Wow, what an amazing little place! Space wise, it was economical, but never cramped, with a comfortable bed and in a very quiet, peaceful area (epescially considering how conveniently close to the airport it was). Bathroom was very nice, the standout being the shower, which consisted of a broad rainfall overhead shower head, in-wall sprayers, and an adjustable head, which could all be easily switched between. The shower was incredibly roomy, easily big enough for 2 people. Kitchen well furnished.
Our host and her partner were both incredibly responsive to our needs. We notified them of a very minor issue, and even then, they responded promply and arrived in person to address and fix it less than 15 minutes later.
In short: A very cozy stay, with an amazing price for the airbnb and its location (around 15 min from IAH). In addition, the hosts are incredibly friendly, responsive, and considerate. I'd highly recommend this location, doubly so for anyone who needs to be close to IAH!

review_text: I enjoyed my stay here, it was small and a great location right next to the airport. The lawn was not mowed and at night the neighbors played loud music. I didn’t feel the safest since there was only one deadbolt. Also wish this was listed as a separated room since there seems to be 3 different Airbnb stays in this one house. Didn’t have any main issues other than the trash can in the kitchen is super small and out grew it on the second day. Also the downstairs was super hot and stuffy compared to the bedroom. Very cool when I slept but any meal making or watching tv downstairs was uncomfortable. There was a slight slip up with me finding a dirty knife with crusty white stuff on it inside the drawer. Witch seems like a total accident and understandable since there is a lot to take account for with having a listing. There were only white bath towels… I was so worried I would stain one! Definitely a tight space but gets the job done for a good price!

This place has the unique factor dialed to a 10! It definitely should be noted that it is a MICRO living space. Like New York small, the kitchen was well equipped for the size and the bed was very comfortable, it also has the best looking shower I’ve seen in a AirBnB so far.
The location is about 20ish min north of downtown which was a little far for me, but not horrible. There is not a dresser or chest for clothes so you will be living out of your suitcase during the stay and it’s not made for people that are vertically blessed #tallpeopleproblems.
Overall I think it’s a great bargain and would recommend this place for a quick trip to H-Town.

review_text: Rebeca’s tiny house is super cute! The perfect place to stay if you’re travelling through Houston. I cannot recommend it enough. Everything was thoughtfully laid out and super clean. The neighborhood was very residential and quiet. Parking is easy, and I found the location very easily even at night. The stairs are indeed steep! But there are several bannisters, lots of good lighting, and it adds to a unique layout that I’ve never experienced before but very much enjoyed! I will definitely be booking with Rebeca again the next time I pass through. Just took all the anxiety out of travelling!

name: Ellie
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I really enjoyed our stay! It was very well decorated and a great layout of the space. I do think it was a great value but there were a few things that disappointed me about this listing:
1) the house was a new build in a calm neighborhood of old brick ranches and it stuck out like a sore thumb
2) we were hoping to doordash some food to the airbnb while we got ready for our event and there were no restaurants around us (just fast-food and gas stations)
3) there was a smell in the space that they were attempting to remedy with air purifiers and air fragrances. We got used to it once inside but upon first entering, it was off-putting.
All in all, it is a good space but i thought it might be helpful to know the negatives so you can decide if those are important to you.
